alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 6:02AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ulster County through 645 AM EDT... At 602 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Woodland Valley Campground to near Rock Hill. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Kingston, New Paltz, Ellenville, Saugerties, Wallkill, Plattekill, Hurley, Woodstock, Modena, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Tillson, West Hurley, Napanoch, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, Phoenicia and Mount Tremper. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
